title: My PC started moving slow after the power went out. What should I do? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’ll make the assumption that you mean a laptop, because otherwise the question makes no sense. Your power settings are probably set for power saving when running on battery power. This is easy to change if you are on windows, just search for “power” (I think, can’t actually check right now) in the windows search bar and it should be among the first results.

Try checking your ram and or other components, electronics are sensitive to power fluctuations, I would get a surge protector to prevent any more damage in case it happens again. A power outage could potentially damage the PSU and Mother Board, It doesn’t seem to be the case with you though. The Power Outage won’t do a great deal in damage but the sudden surge could have affected your PC’S ram and that might be why its slower then usual.
